Step Up
Created by Duane Adler
Original work Step Up

Step Up is an American dance drama multi-media franchise created by Duane Adler. Step Up consists of five films and grossed over $651 million worldwide.

Contents

  • 1 Films
    • 1.1 Step Up (2006)
    • 1.2 Step Up 2: The Streets (2008)
    • 1.3 Step Up 3D (2010)
    • 1.4 Step Up Revolution (2012)
    • 1.5 Step Up: All In (2014)
  • 2 Television series
    • 2.1 Step Up: High Water (2018–present)
  • 3 Principal cast
  • 4 Crew
  • 5 Reception
    • 5.1 Box office
    • 5.2 Critical and public response
  • 6 References

Films[edit]

Step Up (2006)[edit]

Main article: Step Up (film)

Tyler Gage (Channing Tatum) receives the opportunity of a lifetime after vandalizing a performing arts school, gaining him the chance to earn a scholarship and dance with an up-and-coming dancer, Nora Clark (Jenna Dewan).

Step Up 2: The Streets (2008)[edit]

Main article: Step Up 2: The Streets

Romantic sparks occur between two dance students (Andie and Chase) from very different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts.

Step Up 3D (2010)[edit]

Main article: Step Up 3D

A tight-knit group of New York City street dancers, find themselves pitted against the world's best hip hop dancers in a high-stakes showdown.

Step Up Revolution (2012)[edit]

Main article: Step Up Revolution

A group of flash mob dancers, led by Sean (Ryan Guzman), and the daughter Emily (Kathryn McCormick) of a hotel tycoon, attempt to save their Miami homes from being developed into hotels.

Step Up: All In (2014)[edit]

Main article: Step Up: All In

All-stars from the previous Step Up installments come together in glittering Las Vegas, battling for a victory that could define their dreams and their careers.

Television series[edit]

Step Up: High Water (2018–present)[edit]

Main article: Step Up: High Water

A television series titled Step Up: High Water, was released on January 31, 2018 on YouTube Red (now YouTube Premium).
